ru.ispras.sedna.driver
Interface SednaSerializedResult

public interface SednaSerializedResult

Represents the result of the XQuery statement evaluation, it is used to get the result items from the server. Every item is represented as a string. Application can obtain the SednaSerializedResult object using the SednaStatement.getSerializedResult() method.

Note: Application working with Sedna through this Java API has to execute statements and use the results of their execution sequentially. For example the next is incorrect: 

    SednaStatement st1 = con.createStatement();
    SednaStatement st2 = con.createStatement();

    boolean call_res = st1.execute("doc('region')/regions/*");
    call_res = st2.execute("doc('b')/regions/a");

    if (call_res) {
        SednaSerializedResult pr1 = st1.getSerializedResult();
    }

See Also:
SednaStatement.getSerializedResult()

Method Summary
 java.lang.String next()
          Used to iterate over the XQuery statement result sequence.
 int next(java.io.Writer writer)
          Used to iterate over the XQuery statement result sequence.
 

Method Detail

next

java.lang.String next()
                      throws DriverException
Used to iterate over the XQuery statement result sequence.

Returns:
next item of the result of the XQuery statement or null if the sequence has ended.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred while trying to get result item from server.
See Also:
SednaStatement.getSerializedResult()

next

int next(java.io.Writer writer)
         throws DriverException
Used to iterate over the XQuery statement result sequence. Next item of the XQuery statement result will be written into the writer.

Parameters:
writer - a java.io.Writer object to write an result item to.
Returns:
0 if an item was retrieved and written successful, and 1 if the result sequence has ended.
Throws:
DriverException - if some error occurred while trying to get result item from server.
See Also:
SednaStatement.getSerializedResult()
